channel.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
channel.description: I have recently added the "claim" option to my archery tickets through "itemdef" client sided and now I just want to add something that will allow my ticket to give a donator rank when clicking claim. Any ideas and where do I add it ? I assume actionhandler and clickingitem.java will be involved ...

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Add that code to the 3rd click item packet… It’s probably named the same as you saw in the CMD… ItemClick3rdOption.java

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

if (itemId == 1464) { if (c.isDonator == 0) { c.getItems().deleteItem(1464, 1); c.isDonator = 1; c.sendMessage("You have now claimed your Donator rank from your ticket."); } else { c.sendMessage("You are already a donator, There is no need to claim this ticket."); } };

What do I add for it to take the ticket and give the rank to the player because I think I am missing something still as it isn’t fully working in game. Looking around atm. But I changed what mikey put…

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s not an error, that’s saying you’ve used the third click option on the item with an ID of 1464

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

Thanks guys for the help but I got one more issue lol. Not sure what it means I’ve only ever added custom steads and nex sets.

http://prntscr.com/69wwd5

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“portugalrox, post:3, topic:550151”]Not sure if any thing else is required for my ticket but here is the code.

case 1464: itemDef.name = "Donator Ticket"; itemDef.description = "A Donator Rank"; itemDef.actions[1] = "Claim"; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; break;[/quote]

item action “1” (Actually 2, but the number is one because java starts at 0) is actually the Equip item action. Change this:

itemDef.actions[1] = "Claim";
so the 1 is a 2. That should be the first click item action.

Then you’d go in the ClickItem.java file server sided and use something similar to what Mikey just gave you

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @Mikey96 Mikey96
item.description:
@Mikey96 wrote:

I’d go with something along the lines of this:

if (itemId == ####) {
if (c.playerDonator == 0) {
c.getItems().deleteItem(####, 1);
c.playerDonator = 1;
c.sendMessage("You have now claimed your donator rank from your ticket.");
} else {
c.sendMessage("You are already a donator, there is no need to claim this ticket.");
}
}

This is just a rough bit of code sketched up, I am sure it would do the job you could always make improvements.

Read full topic
item.source: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance

item.title: Edit: post 11 and on - Clan chat assistance
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550151”]Well, in reality, it depends on which option you bound it to.

Is it using the wear item packet, the first click packet, second click, etc…
I can’t say because I don’t know which you bound it to.

So… Yeah, can I see what you added to item def?[/quote]
Not sure if any thing else is required for my ticket but here is the code.

case 1464: itemDef.name = "Donator Ticket"; itemDef.description = "A Donator Rank"; itemDef.actions[1] = "Claim"; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; break;

Read full topic
